decks.notes: This UWx Control deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers, like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler, along with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Cards like Monastery Mentor and Snapcaster Mage provide additional threats and card advantage, while countermagic in the form of Force of Will and Force of Negation help protect the game plan. The deck also utilizes snow lands and Arcum's Astrolabe for mana fixing and card draw.

The key concept of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Blood Moon and Ensnaring Bridge. Karn, the Great Creator acts as a versatile toolbox, providing access to various artifacts to deal with different threats. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast, as well as mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb. Overall, the deck aims to control the game while setting up its combo finish.

The main concept of this Aggro - Canadian Threshold deck is to establish early board presence with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland and Daze. The goal is to apply pressure quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will to protect your threats and maintain control of the game. The deck is designed to be proactive and aggressive, aiming to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize and take over.

The deck focuses on using lands as resources to control the game, utilizing cards like Wrenn and Six and Knight of the Reliquary to manipulate the battlefield. Life from the Loam is used to recur lands and keep a steady flow of resources, while Elvish Reclaimer helps find key lands like Dark Depths. Control elements like Swords to Plowshares and Maze of Ith provide protection and removal. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by having a toolbox of lands and creatures at its disposal, creating a strong and resilient game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by taxing their resources while deploying aggressive threats to put pressure on them. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and taxing lands with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, you can slow down your opponent's game plan. Meanwhile, efficient creatures like Mirran Crusader and Stoneforge Mystic help to quickly close out the game. The deck also includes tools like Aether Vial and equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to further enhance your board presence and solidify your advantage.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with Dredge creatures and cards, allowing you to utilize the Dredge mechanic to bring back creatures like Ichorid and Narcomoeba. By using cards like Breakthrough and Faithless Looting, you can quickly fill your graveyard and generate tokens with Bridge from Below. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive swarm of creatures while also utilizing cards like Cabal Therapy to disrupt their game plan.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to ramp quickly into powerful Eldrazi creatures by using lands like Cloudpost and Eldrazi Temple. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to slow down opponents, while utilizing cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to apply pressure and disrupt their game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its large creatures and disrupt their strategies, ultimately winning the game through sheer aggression and disruption.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through the use of counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers while also utilizing the Stoneforge Mystic package to cheat out equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte for added value. The deck aims to establish an early board presence with cards like True-Name Nemesis and then maintain control of the game with the help of Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler. Overall, the deck focuses on disruption and proactive threats to create a winning board state.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building towards a powerful win condition. It combines cards like Wrenn and Six, Life from the Loam, and Exploration to generate value and consistency in land drops. Key cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck also includes cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage for a quick and devastating win condition. The goal is to manage the game through land control and eventually overwhelm the opponent with a powerful land-based strategy.

The main concept of this UR Aggro Legacy deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans while utilizing efficient spells and creatures to deal damage quickly. By utilizing powerful counter spells like Force of Will and Daze, along with versatile removal like Lightning Bolt and Abrade, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis to apply pressure and close out the game. The deck seeks to maintain tempo and aggression to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with a combination of powerful creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and True-Name Nemesis, along with versatile spells like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing a strong board presence with equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull. Support cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide additional card advantage and flexibility, allowing the deck to adapt to different matchups and game states. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to support its control elements and ensure consistent performance.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish board control and pressure the opponent with efficient creatures and cheap interaction spells. By utilizing a combination of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze, along with powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure to win the game quickly. The deck also includes a mix of card draw and card filtering options like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in draws and make optimal plays each turn.

The deck focuses on assembling the Bomberman combo, using Auriok Salvagers and Lion's Eye Diamond to create infinite mana, which can be used to play Walking Ballista for lethal damage. The deck also has utility in cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge to control the board and manipulate the top of the deck. Chalice of the Void and City of Traitors provide additional disruption and fast mana, while Monastery Mentor provides a backup win condition. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently through its combo pieces and disruptive elements.

The deck revolves around quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, supported by cards like Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponents' strategies. Its mana base is built to maximize the ability to cast Eldrazi creatures early in the game, while also including utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas. The deck aims to apply quick pressure on the opponent while also having tools to deal with a variety of threats, making it a strong aggro deck in the Legacy format.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro - Burn deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through a high concentration of burn spells like Fireblast, Rift Bolt, and Lightning Bolt. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient damage while also utilizing creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide to pressure the opponent. Price of Progress is included to punish opponents with non-basic lands, further increasing the deck's speed and consistency in dealing damage.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Dark Depths combo, using Vampire Hexmage or Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck includes a lot of disruption with cards like Duress, Thoughtseize, and Abrupt Decay to protect the combo pieces. It also includes ways to find and tutor for the combo pieces like Elvish Reclaimer, Sylvan Scrying, and Crop Rotation. The deck aims to win the game with the powerful Marit Lage token while disrupting the opponent's game plan.
